Reviews.Title: “Greatest location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Consuelo B
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Cambon for years. You can hardly beat the location. Just a step away from the tube, the Place de la Concorde, Place Vendome, Louvre, Rue Saint Honorée, Opéra, Madeleine... The hotel is in great shape and the bathrooms are all new. They are continually improving the decor and infrastructure. The service is fantastic and although there is only breakfast service, the wonderful Brasserie across the street delivers in the room, if necessary. The rooms are Paris sized, therefore not big for american standards, but adequate for european and they are so cozy and elegant, that staying in them is wonderful. Very comfortable beds! As an experienced traveller, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LazNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week or so, and really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are very small, VERY small, but it's normal for Paris. The hotel has a very pleasant modern design, I was told that the owner of the hotel is an art collector. It's walking distance to the Louvre, you can spend there days and days... Opera and Madeleine is in 7 minutes walking distance. Ladies, be aware! Next to the hotel is 31, Rue Cambon, the VERY first Chanel store opened by Coco Chanel. You'll end up going there as often as to the Louvre if you're a Chanel lover. ;) Just across the hotel there is a wonderful restaurant, loved by the locals, I'm highly recommending to check it out. There were 2 things that bothered me... a little. The hotel closes the entrance doors for the night, so you have to buzz the concierge if you're coming back late. And, hey, you're in Paris, city of Love and Lights. It's silly but I felt kind of awkward when I was going back to my room at 4 am with a guy, and had to buzz the concierge... Felt like a highschool kid coming home. :/ The other thing that bothered me was the payment. When I got to the hotel, I was told that the 255 euro a night included the breakfast. So every morning I had the breakfast at the hotel (not the best selection - just cheese plates, bread, croissants, fresh juices, yogurts). When I was checking out I had to pay 20 euro for every breakfast I had. :( And the same concierge that helped me during my arrival and confirmed that the total included the breakfast (she wrote - b+b meaning bed and breakfast on my papers), the same concierge told me I was mistaken and breakfast is never included. Otherwise, it's a good hotel, but I am not going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BeliNY
Reviews.Content: Amazing location. The room was very tiny though. Expensive breakfast, better to go to bar close by. Guess my experience would have been even better if the elevator hadn't been out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could possiblity wanted”
Reviews.Author: notchincorporated
Reviews.Content: Size may have been small, but the staffs efforts and attitude were very large. My visit was perfect in part to the comfort of my room, hardy morning breakfast, and location in the center of Paris. This hotel will always remain my go to hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel & great location!”
Reviews.Author: NicWest66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a breath of fresh air from the boring corporate hotels we usually stay in. Lots of character and the staff were very helpful. It is situated in a great location and the best food we had whilst there was in the restaurant directly opposite! (Flottes).I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Sweet Paris...Candy In teh Rooms and Everything!”
Reviews.Author: NakaligraceGauthier
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at this wonderfully located and charming hotel in teh heart of Paris. I actually thought it would be expensive and typical Paris with people who could not speak English and unfriendly, just the opposite in fact. I loved the ambiance and the charm of this hotel and would recommend any couple or solo traveler to choose this location. It is a smaller hotel but that is the best part, not over the top and not understated. The rooms like most in Paris are small, but I enjoyed the space none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, welcoming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cambon is a boutique hotel steps from the Place de la Concorde and also a short walk from the Fauborg Sainte Honore or the Louvre. The entrance and lobby are corporate-comfortable; the staff are warm, English-speaking and responsive; and the rooms are stylish and even slightly whimsical. Quiet rooms overlook a central courtyard which is sunny on the upper floors. Wireless is trouble-free though one pays a daily fee. The breakfast buffet is a bit predictable and skimpy, which was perhaps the only issue with our stay. There is a relaxed, personal air about the hotel, so one feels at home fairly readily. It's a good hotel for newcomers to the city, not least because of its location in the middle of iconic Paris. (Recommended in the neighborhood: the terrace of L'Absinthe in the early evening, a convivial restaurant with an interesting menu.)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cambon”
Reviews.Author: jkfchan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Cambon. The location is unbeatable. It is close to all the major tourist attractions and major shopping district. The shear convenience well worth its price. In fact the price is quite reasonable with breakfast included. I am especially pleased with all the staffs. They have tried very hard to make us satisfied. I am especially satisfied with their pick up service. Our driver is already waiting for us outside the arrival gate. When we leave our car is already parked outside waiting for us. Their attention to detail is unbeatable. The room size is not big but quite adequate. The bathroom is very functional. In summary its been a pleasant stay. I will definitely stay at Hotel Cambon when I come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique! Great Place to Stay! An incredibly helpful and knowledgeable Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ed_guillen2001
Reviews.Content: I am a business man who has to travel a great deal here in the States and abroad. Iâ€™ve seen a lot of clean rooms and a good share of terrific places. If you are like me, part of the experience and appeal of a place naturally evolve to incorporate how friendly and knowledgeable the hotel staff is and the type service received. The Hotel Cambon in Paris, France has it all!!! Tastefully decorated and clean rooms, a beautiful lobby, a perfect address that makes it convenient to launch your most demanding of Parisian sightseeing tours but equally as important, an unparallel service by staff, who I found to be genuinely friendly, extremely knowledgeable, and for anyone new to Paris a sigh of relief. A Perfect Stay! A Perfect Hotel!!! If you are going to Paris, France for business or vacation, stay at the Hotel Cambon. I most definitely recommend this hotel over and over again. Confirmation: 131855731 (January 2011)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: DHwang
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cambon is located in a very strategic location in Paris, where you can easily walk to several important tourism spots in Paris (eg Louvre Museum, Jardin des Tuileries,Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, Arc de Triomphe).. The standard room is small but complete and clean. The view from room has nothing too fantastic though. Breakfast will be available at a fee of EUR17, which I find it quite expensive. However I wish to give compliments to Hotel Cambon for its service. Very helpful, sincere and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: marigo13
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Cambon for two nights in January when it was bitterly cold in Paris. The hotel was warm and comfortable and the room a very generous size for Paris. I would say of all the hotels I have stayed in the Rue Cambon or District 1 area, this hotel had the largest rooms - I stress, largest based on Paris standards. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Most of all, I have to thank the lady who cleaned my room. I left my engagement ring by the washbasin one day and left the room. I didn't realise I didn't have the ring with me till after dinner and was in a right panic thinking I've lost it. I wasn't even sure where I had left it. When I left the room, housekeeping was just coming in and I met this lovely woman briefly. Imagine my relief and joy when I returned to the room to find the ring exactly where I had left it. I was in room 122 and this happened on Sunday 23 January. If I have any negative comments it would be the colour scheme of the room was not to my taste. And free internet access would have been nice since most hotels now offer it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, small but newly updated”
Reviews.Author: KWerner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights this month with my husband. Friends stayed in another of their rooms. The rooms are small by American standards, but the bathrooms had all of the brand new amenities that we enjoy. Not a lot of storage space,but this is expected in Europe. The room was cleaned early every day and there were no sign of bedbugs or any other kind of problem, which is important when travelling in Europe. The staff was very nice and helpful, and the owner had a little Dachshund that was behind the desk daily...very cute! We had a balcony onto the front, which you had to step up to, but was a nice way to watch the small street and life below. I would return again to this little unknown gem.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat walking a block into...”
Reviews.Author: Susanten
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat walking a block into Tuileries and seeing the Concord obelisk and the Eif Tower. It's a lively hotel --fun environment and if you can afford the upgrade with the bathroom with tub you will be comfortable. In this neighborhood each square inch is so valuable. Easy Metro everywhere. You'll Luke it here

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful value in a fabulous location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie070
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 5 night stay at the Hotel Cambon. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do. The service was excellent - at breakfast and at the front desk, where we were given all the help we needed, including umbrellas and an extension cord so I could use my converter to charge my camera battery. The beds were extremely comfortable with excellent linens. My only complaint would be that there were no drawers in which to place clothing, necessitating our working out of our bags. I would definitely recommend Hotel Cambon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: BamsBams
Reviews.Content: (i) Fabulous location to all high-end shopping sights as well as touristy spots - all within walking distance; (ii) Clean and comfortable; friendly staff; (iii) Expensive for this class of hotel, but what would I expect, this is Paris

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and well run”
Reviews.Author: TMH02
Reviews.Content: This is a small, elegant hotel. The staff were singularly polite, helpful, and all spoke English. The decor is sophisticated and pleasant. The continental breakfast was generous and tasty. The AC worked well (I keep it on the cold side). There was no noise problem even on the street side. The rooms are quite small, but very adequate. The beds are comfortable. My only complaint is a swinging glass door mounted on the tub side which is supposed to contain shower water, but, covering only half of the opening, does not do so. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: BrownGirlsTour
Reviews.Content: If you would like to stay in the 1st arrondissement of Paris then Hotel Cambon is a lovely boutique hotel in a great location (Tuilleries Gardens is just across the road). The staff were friendly and helpful. The traffic noise from nearby Rue Rivoli was blocked out by efficient window shutters. The hotel offers an excellent airport pick up service.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: marilyn0415
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff - very helpful, polite and friendly. Love the location of the hotel. This was my second stay at Hotel Cambon and plan to stay there again on my next visit. Also, appreciated the clealiness of the hotel. Sincerely, Marilyn Fitzgerald

Reviews.Title: “Mauvais rapport qualitÃ© prix / Bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: frqntBizTravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights on business travel at Eur 250 p.n. without breakfast. Frankly, I know much better places for this money or less. The room was very small (perhaps even smaller than in a two star), bedding was terrible: old mattress with dips such that I would wake up with a back ache, torn out sheets (no joke). Will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in April 1973”
Reviews.Author: richardrobins
Reviews.Content: Well, it was on the same location. I still remember how remarkable the rue is. I was single and traveling alone. I spent 7 delightful nights on this property. In the last 25 years, my family and I have rented apartments on the Left Bank, but I still remember the neighborhood. At the top of the street is The Madeleine, at the bottom is the Tuileries.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: retired_travelers0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our home base while spending a week in Paris â€“ my first time in France. It exceeded our expectations. Hotel Cambon is an eclectic mix of antique objets dâ€™art and modern dÃ©cor. A wonderful location just steps from Rue de Rivoli near the Octagon Pool of the Tuileries, youâ€™ll find both a taxi stop and the Concorde metro stop, a great convenience for senior travelers. Our room on the top (7th) floor walked out onto a cozy private balcony with a table and chairs for 2 where we enjoyed our wine while overlooking the rooftops of Paris. We had a flat-screen TV, king-sized bed, original artwork, sofa and coffee table, desk with internet connection and large bathroom with tub, shower and bidet. Three windows opened onto picturesque views. Our hosts, Guilliame and Stephanie, both spoke English and were polite and knowledgeable and the staff kept our room spotless. We were a short walk from the Orsay Museum and the Orangerie, and a longer walk to the Louvre through the Tuileries or, in the other direction, to the Arc de Triomphe along the Champs-Elysees. Although we did not dine at the hotel, there were ample restaurants and cafÃ©s nearby. Nights were quiet (except for the cooing rooftop pigeons towards dawn). My only recommendation would be to bring hair conditioner, as the water here tends to be quite hard and conditioner was not among the supplied toiletries. All in all, a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: AnniHManchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Paris staying at the Cambon Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location, just a short walk from some of the most spectacular sights in Paris. The room was very small but also very comfortable with everything in it that you would need for a short stay.The staff were extremely pleasant and couldn't do enough for you. However there is no restaurant in the hotel, only a small breakfast room (approx 7 tables) and for the price we paid, and from a hotel with a 4 * rating I would expect a bit more than was available. I would go back to the Cambon but only after checking out some of the other deals on 4* hotels in the area. I'm not sure that this hotel was the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Center of it All!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLucia
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th stay at this lovely hotel. Service, atmosphere & the friendly staff are a true delight. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower & just a short stroll away from the Louvre. The cafes' & restaurants in the area offer various menus. All in all, a wonderful experience. Looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our trip special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this on the second last day of a 11 day stay at the Hotel Cambon, from June 9 until June 20. We traveled with my wife, 1 year old baby and mother in law. The staff catered to us and now anticipates our daily needs for the baby. When we arrived the night lone deskman called his wife at home to ensure the milk was suitable for our baby. One recommended fabulous restaurant L'ardoise. Travelling with a baby is not the easiest thing to do and the staff at this hotel has made it very enjoyable. They upgraded our rooms to the two suites on the seventh floor for a reasonable upgrade rate. The sevent floor suites have cute small litte two people terraces that made for a romantic anniversary for my wife and I. My thanks to the staff at hotel cambon

Reviews.Title: “friendly and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely a friendly and hospitable hotel with great staff. I would return for holidays and stay in this hotel. Thank you for being hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “little treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel cambon is just a short walk to the louvre and some wonderful shops and near fine small places to eat/ the staff has been there many years and it has a true and lovely way of welcome/ the rooms are new and the design elegant. We had a wonderful stay//

Reviews.Title: “Lilliput Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cambon is in an excellent location in the very heart of Paris but the rooms are so small it is impossible to walk around the room. We had a 3rd bed added for a little boy and to go to the miniscule bathroom we had basically to walk on the beds. For $280 per night I expected a bit more space.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cambon
HotelInfo.Address: 3 rue Cambon | 01 Arr., 75001 Paris, France
